snippet: A robust 33.4 million watched Monday’s game between Ohio State and Oregon on ESPN, but the figure fell short of the Nielsen record of 35.6 million, set by the 2006 title game, which was shown on ABC.
abstract: Some 33.4 million viewers tune in to College Football Championship game between Ohio State and Oregon, setting cable television record; figure still falls short of 35.6 million who watched 2006 Rose Bowl game, which was shown on ABC.
lead_paragraph: A robust 33.4 million watched Monday’s game between Ohio State and Oregon on ESPN, but the figure fell short of the Nielsen record of 35.6 million, set by the 2006 title game, which was shown on ABC.

headline.main: Title Game Sets Ratings Record for Cable, but Not Over All
headline.print_headline: A Ratings Record for Cable, but Not Over All
